title: Mandy Moore is a ray of sunshine in a canary-yellow dress at the Veuve Clicquot Polo Classic
text:
She earned her first Emmy nomination this year for her role on NBC's This Is Us.

And Mandy Moore shone in a dress as bright as her star on Saturday as she donned a canary-yellow dress at the Veuve Clicquot Polo Classic at the Will Rogers State Historic Park in LA.

The 35-year-old actress grinned from ear-to-ear as she modeled the ankle-grazing frock dipped in floral embroidery and finished off with a plunging neckline.

Sunny: Mandy Moore shone in a dress as bright as her star on Saturday as she donned a canary-yellow dress at the Veuve Clicquot Polo Classic at the Will Rogers State Historic Park in LA

She paired the look with a boxy grey snakeskin purse and reflective strappy sandals with a wooden heel.

Mandy kept her makeup minimal, allowing her natural beauty to shine through and adorned her brunette bob with a pearl-encrusted barrette.

She posed alongside style icon Rachel Zoe and fellow actress Busy Philipps during the event.

Bright: The 35-year-old actress grinned from ear-to-ear as she modeled the ankle-grazing frock dipped in floral embroidery and finished off with a plunging neckline

Her appearance comes a couple of weeks after she debuted her first single in over ten years entitled When I Wasn't Watching alongside a music video directed by Lauren Dukoff.

She told People of the release on the red carpet at the 2019 Emmy Awards: 'I just "dropped it," as the kids say.'

'I am super excited about it and happy that people have been digging it so far.'

Posh: She posed alongside style icon Rachel Zoe and fellow actress Busy Philipps during the event

Mandy continued to say that the reception for the song has been 'extremely positive.'

'I’m so overwhelmed and heartened that people even know or still care that I make music, because I really truly am still doing it selfishly for me,' she said.

'I miss it, I miss writing, I miss performing, I miss the whole thing, so it feels really, really good to be back there.'

She added: 'It’s not a bad deal, I feel incredibly lucky. I am just soaking in every second of this particular moment.'

Love: The Nashua, N.H. native collaborated with her husband, Dawes frontman Taylor Goldsmith, on the single

The Nashua, N.H. native collaborated with her husband, Dawes frontman Taylor Goldsmith, on the single.

Goldsmith opened up to People about working with Mandy on her new music.

'It means so much to me because I know it means so much to her,' he said.

'I watch her light up as she gets to express herself again as a songwriter and singer in the way she hasn’t in a long time. It’s so inspiring.'

Mandy is set to put out another single before the end of 2019.
